## Effect() function

Create an Effect service factory.

Effects are side effects that run when their dependencies change. They run immediately on creation and re-run whenever any dependency changes.

\*\*Most users should use the preset instead:\*\*

```ts
import { createSignalsSvc } from '@lattice/signals/presets/core';
const { effect } = createSignalsSvc();
```

**Signature:**

```typescript
Effect: (args_0?: EffectOptions | undefined) => import("@lattice/lattice").Service<EffectFactory, EffectDeps>
```

## Parameters

</th><th>

</th><th>

</th></tr></thead>

args\_0


</td><td>

</td><td>

_(Optional)_


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

import("@lattice/lattice").[Service](../../lattice/service/)<!-- -->&lt;[EffectFactory](../effectfactory/)<!-- -->, EffectDeps&gt;

## Example 1

Basic effect

```ts
const { signal, effect } = createSignalsSvc();

const count = signal(0);

const dispose = effect(() => {
  console.log(`Count is ${count()}`);
});
// logs: "Count is 0"

count(1); // logs: "Count is 1"
count(2); // logs: "Count is 2"

dispose(); // stops tracking
count(3);  // no log
```

## Example 2

With cleanup

```ts
const dispose = effect(() => {
  const id = setInterval(() => console.log('tick'), 1000);

  // Return cleanup function
  return () => clearInterval(id);
});

// Cleanup runs before each re-execution and on dispose
dispose();
```

## Example 3

DOM updates

```ts
const title = signal('Hello');

effect(() => {
  document.title = title();
});

title('World'); // Document title updates automatically
```
